description: From pedo- (“relating to soil”) +‎ Latin al(umen) + fer(rum).

entries.meaning: (geology) Soil containing aluminum and iron that lacks a hardened layer of carbonates.
examples: In respect of properties of the fine fraction, lithosols may be pedalfers or pedocals, but their morphology is dominated by rock, stones or concretionary material. Regosols, immature soils on sands, are included in this group for convenience.
